data.title: 91 Thunderbird 5.0 from the movie Jade is
data.text:
Earl

· Registered

Joined Jul 14, 2002

·

6,521 Posts

No, its a 92 sport. The 92 sport had the same style front and rear bumper as the 93, and almost the same moldings except that on the sides it had chrome trim at the back of the quarter molding, which 93s didn't have. If you pause the video at 1:32 there is a broadside shot of the car, and you can see the chrome on the body side molding. Between that and the wheels, that tells me it is a 92 sport. Granted someone could have changed the wheels, but on a movie set, if they were going to change the wheels because some were damaged, they would probably get the same style wheels so they have continuity through the film. Plus there is no reason they would take off the body side moldings to replace them with an earlier style with such a slight difference.

You make an interesting point, and frankly, I think you are right, I stand corrected :thumbsup:

XR7-4.6

· Banned

1994 Cougar XR7 DOHC/5-Speed

Joined Apr 7, 2006

·

25,077 Posts

That doesn't say it was a sport, 92 LX's were identical to the sport other than the tape stripes and badge. Only the base had the non SC style bumper in 92.

It's not uncommon for there to be more than one car used for stunts in a movie, but the pic in the first post is clearly a 93. As for the wheels 89-92 wheels would've been much more common at the time of the filming than fanblades. If you know you needed to stockpile wheels for stunts are you going to use a 5 year old wheel or a two year old wheel design to trash multiple times?
